Quick Start Guide

NOTE: You will need to make sure your Android SDK is up to date. Make sure you're using Revision 15 or higher. (To update your tools run the "android" command in your Android SDK and update the SDK from there.)

Use Maven

Simple copy-paste the following two commands to get up-and-running with template project.

mvn org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-dependency-plugin:2.1:get \
    -DrepoUrl=https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/ \
    -Dartifact=com.willowtreeapps:oak-archetype:1.0.9-SNAPSHOT
 mvn archetype:generate -DarchetypeGroupId=com.willowtreeapps -DarchetypeArtifactId=oak-archetype \
                        -DarchetypeVersion=1.0.9-SNAPSHOT

Use your existing Android Ant build file

In the root of your Android project, copy the following into a file called build-ivy.xml

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project name="ivyimported" basedir="." xmlns:ivy="antlib:org.apache.ivy.ant">

    <property name="ivy.install.version" value="2.2.0"/>

    <condition property="ivy.home" value="${env.IVY_HOME}">
        <isset property="env.IVY_HOME"/>
    </condition>
    <property name="ivy.home" value="${user.home}/.ant"/>
    <property name="ivy.jar.dir" value="${ivy.home}/lib"/>
    <property name="ivy.jar.file" value="${ivy.jar.dir}/ivy.jar"/>
    <property name="ivy.lib.dir" value="${basedir}/libs"/>

    <target name="download-ivy" unless="offline">

        <mkdir dir="${ivy.jar.dir}"/>
        <!-- download Ivy from web site so that it can be used even without any special installation -->
        <get src="http://repo2.maven.org/maven2/org/apache/ivy/ivy/${ivy.install.version}/ivy-${ivy.install.version}.jar"
             dest="${ivy.jar.file}" usetimestamp="true"/>
    </target>

    <target name="init-ivy" depends="download-ivy">
        <!-- try to load ivy here from ivy home, in case the user has not already dropped
it into ant's lib dir (note that the latter copy will always take precedence).
We will not fail as long as local lib dir exists (it may be empty) and
ivy is in at least one of ant's lib dir or the local lib dir. -->
        <path id="ivy.lib.path">
            <fileset dir="${ivy.jar.dir}" includes="*.jar"/>

        </path>
        <taskdef resource="org/apache/ivy/ant/antlib.xml"
                 uri="antlib:org.apache.ivy.ant" classpathref="ivy.lib.path"/>
        <ivy:settings file="ivysettings.xml"/>
    </target>

    <target name="fetch-dependencies" depends="init-ivy">
        <delete>
            <fileset dir="${ivy.lib.dir}" includes="oak-library*"/>
        </delete>
        <ivy:retrieve/>
    </target>
</project>

In the same directory create a file called ivysettings.xml and copy in the following:

<ivysettings>
    <settings defaultResolver="chain"/>
    <property name="local-maven2-pattern"
              value="${user.home}/.m2/repository/[organisation]/[module]/[revision]/[module]-[revision](-[classifier]).[ext]"
              override="false"/>

    <resolvers>
        <chain name="chain">
            <ibiblio name="willowtreeapps" m2compatible="true"
                     usepoms="true"
                     root="http://maven.willowtreeapps.com/repository/internal/"/>
            <ibiblio name="willowtreeapps-snapshot" m2compatible="true" changingPattern=".*-SNAPSHOT"
                     checkmodified="true" usepoms="true"
                     root="http://maven.willowtreeapps.com/repository/snapshots/"
                     pattern="[organisation]/[module]/[revision]/[artifact]-[revision](-[classifier]).[ext]"/>
            <filesystem
                    name="local-maven2"
                    checkmodified="true"
                    m2compatible="true" changingPattern=".*-SNAPSHOT">
                <ivy pattern="${local-maven2-pattern}"/>
                <artifact pattern="${local-maven2-pattern}"/>
            </filesystem>
        </chain>
    </resolvers>
</ivysettings>

Create another file called ivy.xml and copy in the following:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ivy-module version="2.0">
    <info organisation="com.example" module="examplemodule"/>
    <dependencies>
        <dependency org="com.willowtreeapps" name="oak-library" rev="1.0.9-SNAPSHOT" transitive="false" changing="true"/>
        <dependency org="com.google.guava" name="guava" rev="10.0.1" transitive="false" changing="false" />
    </dependencies>
</ivy-module>

Modify your existing build.xml file to include the following:

<import file="build-ivy.xml"/>

Run the following command to automatically fetch the library from server

(NOTE: To use a different version of OAK, simply change the rev attribute in your ivy.xml file):

ant fetch-dependencies
